00733 }
00734 #else

00815 /**
00816  * cvmx_nqm_cfg
00817  */
00818 union cvmx_nqm_cfg {
00819     uint64_t u64;
00820     struct cvmx_nqm_cfg_s {
00821 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00822     uint64_t mjr                          : 16; /**< Major version number.
00823                                                          This global value is reflected in all NQM_VF()_VS[MJR] fields. */
00824     uint64_t mnr                          : 16; /**< Minor version number.
00825                                                          This global value is reflected in all NQM_VF()_VS[MNR] fields. */
00826     uint64_t reserved_16_31               : 16;
00827     uint64_t to                           : 8;  /**< Timeout.  Worst case time that host software shall wait
00828                                                          for the controller to become ready (NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] set) after a
00829                                                          power-on or reset.  This worst case time may be experienced after
00830                                                          an unclean shutdown; typical times are expected to be much shorter.
00831                                                          This field is in 500 millisecond units.  The reset value corresponds
00832                                                          to 127.5 seconds.
00833                                                          This global value is reflected in all NQM_VF()_CAP[TO] fields. */
00834     uint64_t reserved_3_7                 : 5;
00835     uint64_t ld_type                      : 2;  /**< Load type mode bit. Specifies the CPL entry load type (LDD if 0x1,
00836                                                          LDI (default) if 0x0, LDWB if 0x2). */
00837     uint64_t st_type                      : 1;  /**< Store type mode bit. Specifies the work-queue entry store type
00838                                                          (STT if 1, STF if 0). */
00839 #else
00840     uint64_t st_type                      : 1;
00841     uint64_t ld_type                      : 2;
00842     uint64_t reserved_3_7                 : 5;
00843     uint64_t to                           : 8;
00844     uint64_t reserved_16_31               : 16;
00845     uint64_t mnr                          : 16;
00846     uint64_t mjr                          : 16;
00847 #endif
00848     } s;
00849     struct cvmx_nqm_cfg_s                 cn73xx;
00850 };
00851 typedef union cvmx_nqm_cfg cvmx_nqm_cfg_t;

01156                                                          Bit numbers within this field are enumerated by NQM_HS_MEM_CTL0_RAMS_E. */
01157 #else
01158     uint64_t dbe                          : 16;
01159     uint64_t reserved_16_19               : 4;
01160     uint64_t sbe                          : 16;
01161     uint64_t reserved_36_63               : 28;
01162 #endif
01163     } s;
01164     struct cvmx_nqm_hs_ecc0_int_s         cn73xx;

01202  */

01206 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01207     uint64_t reserved_18_63               : 46;
01208     uint64_t div                          : 18; /**< Coalescing divider (used for MSI-X only). As defined in the NVMe standard,
01209                                                          Time-based coalescing operates with a 100 microsecond tick. This register
01210                                                          specifies how many coprocessor-clocks there are in a 25 microsecond period. If
01211                                                          the coprocessor-clock period is 1.0 ns then the default value of 25,000 is
01212                                                          correct. The value 66 is a minimum; this is forced if you write below 66.
01213                                                          _ Timer_tick_period = coprossoror_clock_freq * [DIV] */
01214 #else

01464 /**
01465  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_acq
01466  *
01467  * NQM_VF(x)_ACQ is the NVMe-standard admin completion queue base address (ACQ)
01468  * CSR for function x. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the functions that are actually
01469  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01470  *
01471  * This CSR should only be written and only be migrated when the corresponding
01472  * CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ(0)_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
01473  * for the admin CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
01474  */
01475 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq {
01476     uint64_t u64;
01477     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_s {
01478 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01479     uint64_t acqb                         : 52; /**< Admin completion queue base.  Indicates the 64-bit physical address
01480                                                          for the admin completion queue. This address shall be memory page
01481                                                          aligned (based upon NQM_VF()_CC[MPS]). All completion queue entries
01482                                                          for the commands submitted to the admin submission queue shall be
01483                                                          posted to this completion queue. This queue is always associated with
01484                                                          interrupt vector 0.  This field is read-only when both NQM_VF()_CC[EN]
01485                                                          and NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] are asserted. */
01486     uint64_t reserved_0_11                : 12;
01487 #else
01488     uint64_t reserved_0_11                : 12;
01489     uint64_t acqb                         : 52;
01490 #endif
01491     } s;
01492     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_s             cn73xx;
01493 };
01494 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_t;
01495 
01496 /**
01497  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_acq_cc
01498  *
01499  * NQM_VF(x)_ACQ_CC contains admin completion queue configuration for function x.
01500  * NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the functions that are actually
01501  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01502  *
01503  * This CSR should only be written and should only be migrated when the corresponding
01504  * admin CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ(0)_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
01505  * for the admin CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
01506  */
01507 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_cc {
01508     uint64_t u64;
01509     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_cc_s {
01510 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01511     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01512     uint64_t iv                           : 5;  /**< Interrupt vector.  Interrupt vector associated with this queue.
01513                                                          Must be zero (i.e. must be NQM_VF_INT_VEC_E::NQM_ADMIN_CQ). */
01514     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
01515     uint64_t p                            : 1;  /**< Phase tag. Indicates the phase tag that NQM will
01516                                                          write with the next completion.
01517                                                          Software should set [P]=1 prior to first enabling a new
01518                                                          CPL/CQ.
01519                                                          [P] and corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ(0)_TAIL[PT] are one and the same.
01520                                                          A write to either [P] or corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ(0)_TAIL[PT] updates
01521                                                          both. */
01522     uint64_t ien                          : 1;  /**< Interrupt enable. Interrupts are enabled when asserted.
01523                                                          [IEN] should always be set since admin CQ interrupts cannot be disabled (according
01524                                                          to the NVMe standard). */
01525     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
01526 #else
01527     uint64_t reserved_0_0                 : 1;
01528     uint64_t ien                          : 1;
01529     uint64_t p                            : 1;
01530     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
01531     uint64_t iv                           : 5;
01532     uint64_t reserved_9_63                : 55;
01533 #endif
01534     } s;
01535     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_cc_s          cn73xx;
01536 };
01537 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_cc cvmx_nqm_vfx_acq_cc_t;
01538 
01539 /**
01540  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_aqa
01541  *
01542  * NQM_VF(x)_AQA is the NVMe-standard admin queue attributes (AQA)
01543  * CSR for function x. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the functions that
01544  * are actually present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01545  *
01546  * This CSR should only be written and only be migrated when the corresponding
01547  * CPL/CQ and SQ are idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ(0)_ENA[ENABLE] is
01548  * an enable for the CPL/CQ.  NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle
01549  * conditions. The corresponding NQM_VF()_SQ(0)_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable for
01550  * the SQ. NQM_VF()_SQ(0)_ENA[ENABLE] describes SQ idle conditions.
01551  */
01552 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_aqa {

01557     uint32_t acqs                         : 12; /**< Admin completion queue size. Defines the size of the admin completion
01558                                                          queue in entries. The minimum size of the admin completion queue is
01559                                                          two entries. The maximum size of the admin completion queue is 4096
01560                                                          entries. This field is read-only when both NQM_VF()_CC[EN] and
01561                                                          NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] are asserted. */
01562     uint32_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
01563     uint32_t asqs                         : 12; /**< Admin submission queue size. Defines the size of the admin submission
01564                                                          queue in entries. The minimum size of the admin submission queue is
01565                                                          two entries. The maximum size of the admin submission queue is 4096
01566                                                          entries. This field is read-only when both NQM_VF()_CC[EN] and
01567                                                          NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] are asserted. */
01568 #else
01569     uint32_t asqs                         : 12;
01570     uint32_t reserved_12_15               : 4;
01571     uint32_t acqs                         : 12;
01572     uint32_t reserved_28_31               : 4;
01573 #endif
01574     } s;
01575     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_aqa_s             cn73xx;
01576 };
01577 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_aqa cvmx_nqm_vfx_aqa_t;

01597                                                          of I/O submission queues and I/O completions queues shall be submitted

01610 /**
01611  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cap
01612  *
01613  * NQM_VF(x)_CAP is the NVMe-standard controller capabilities (CAP) CSR for
01614  * function x. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the functions that are actually
01615  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01616  */
01617 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cap {
01618     uint64_t u64;
01619     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cap_s {
01620 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01621     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
01622     uint64_t mpsmax                       : 4;  /**< Memory page size maximum.  The maximum host
01623                                                          memory page size supported by this controller, specified
01624                                                          as (2 ^ (12 + MPSMAX)) bytes.  This controller supports the full
01625                                                          range from 4 KB to 128 MB as denoted by the value of 0xF. */
01626     uint64_t mpsmin                       : 4;  /**< Memory page size minimum. The minimum host memory
01627                                                          page size supported by this controller, specified as
01628                                                          (2 ^ (12 + MPSMIN)) bytes, thus 0x0 corresponds to 4 KB.  The host
01629                                                          shall not configure a memory page size in NQM_VF()_CC[MPS] that is
01630                                                          smaller than this value. */
01631     uint64_t reserved_45_47               : 3;
01632     uint64_t css                          : 8;  /**< Command set supported. Only the NVM command set is supported. */
01633     uint64_t nssrs                        : 1;  /**< NVM subsystem reset is not supported. */
01634     uint64_t dstrd                        : 4;  /**< Doorbell stride.  The stride is specified as (2 ^ (2 + DSTRD)) in
01635                                                          bytes.  A value of 0x0 indicates a stride of 4 bytes, where the
01636                                                          doorbell registers are packed without reserved space between each
01637                                                          register. */
01638     uint64_t to                           : 8;  /**< Timeout.  Worst case time that host software shall wait
01639                                                          for the controller to become ready (NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] set) after a
01640                                                          power-on or reset.  This worst case time may be experienced after
01641                                                          an unclean shutdown; typical times are expected to be much shorter.
01642                                                          This field is in 500 millisecond units.  The reset value corresponds
01643                                                          to 127.5 seconds.
01644                                                          [TO] is a RO copy of NQM_CFG[TO]. [TO] can be modified by software
01645                                                          via NQM_CFG. */
01646     uint64_t reserved_19_23               : 5;
01647     uint64_t ams                          : 2;  /**< Arbitration mechanism supported.  Only round-robin is supported. */
01648     uint64_t cqr                          : 1;  /**< Contiguous queues required.  The controller supports I/O submission
01649                                                          queues and I/O completion queues that are not physically contiguous. */
01650     uint64_t mqes                         : 16; /**< Maximum queue entries supported.  Indicates the maximum
01651                                                          individual queue size that the controller supports. This value applies
01652                                                          to each of the I/O submission queues and I/O completion queues that
01653                                                          host software may create. This is a 0's based value. The value
01654                                                          0x0FFF indicate 4096 entries. */
01655 #else
01656     uint64_t mqes                         : 16;
01657     uint64_t cqr                          : 1;
01658     uint64_t ams                          : 2;
01659     uint64_t reserved_19_23               : 5;
01660     uint64_t to                           : 8;
01661     uint64_t dstrd                        : 4;
01662     uint64_t nssrs                        : 1;
01663     uint64_t css                          : 8;
01664     uint64_t reserved_45_47               : 3;
01665     uint64_t mpsmin                       : 4;
01666     uint64_t mpsmax                       : 4;
01667     uint64_t reserved_56_63               : 8;
01668 #endif
01669     } s;
01670     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cap_s             cn73xx;
01671 };
01672 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cap cvmx_nqm_vfx_cap_t;
01673 
01674 /**
01675  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cc
01676  *
01677  * NQM_VF(x)_CC is the NVMe-standard controller configuration (CC) CSR for
01678  * function x. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the functions that are actually
01679  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01680  */
01681 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cc {
01682     uint32_t u32;
01683     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cc_s {
01684 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01685     uint32_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
01686     uint32_t iocqes                       : 4;  /**< I/O completion queue entry size.  Defines the I/O
01687                                                          completion queue entry size in bytes and is formatted as a power of
01688                                                          two (2^n).  The value 0x4 corresponds to a size of 16 bytes.  The
01689                                                          value is also reflected in byte 513 of the identify controller data
01690                                                          structure. */
01691     uint32_t iosqes                       : 4;  /**< I/O submission queue entry size.  Defines the I/O
01692                                                          submission queue entry size  in bytes and is formatted as a power of
01693                                                          two (2^n).  The value 0x6 corresponds to a size of 64 bytes.  The
01694                                                          value is also reflected in byte 512 of the identify controller data
01695                                                          structure. */
01696     uint32_t shn                          : 2;  /**< Shutdown notification.  Initiates shutdown
01697                                                          processing when a shutdown is occurring (i.e., a power down condition
01698                                                          is expected). For a normal shutdown notification, it is expected that
01699                                                          the controller is given time to process the shutdown notification.
01700                                                          For an abrupt shutdown notification, the host may not wait for
01701                                                          shutdown processing to complete before power is lost.
01702                                                          The shutdown notification values are defined as:
01703                                                               0x0 = No notification; no effect.
01704                                                               0x1 = Normal shutdown notification.
01705                                                               0x2 = Abrupt shutdown notification.
01706                                                          This field should be written by host software prior to any power down
01707                                                          condition and prior to any change of the PCI power management state.
01708                                                          It is recommended that this field also be written prior to a warm
01709                                                          reboot. To determine when shutdown processing is complete, refer to
01710                                                          NQM_VF()_CSTS[SHST]. */
01711     uint32_t ams                          : 3;  /**< Arbitration mechanism selected:  Selects the arbitration
01712                                                          mechanism to be used.  The controller only support round-robin (0x0). */
01713     uint32_t mps                          : 4;  /**< Memory page size.  Indicates the host memory page size in
01714                                                          (2 ^ (12 + MPS)) bytes. The minimum host memory page
01715                                                          size is 4KB and the maximum host memory page size is 128MB as defined
01716                                                          by NQM_VF()_CAP[MPSMAX] and NQM_VF()_CAP[MPSMIN].
01717                                                          This field describes the value used for PRP entry size. */
01718     uint32_t css                          : 3;  /**< I/O command set selected:  Only NVM command set (0x0) is supported. */
01719     uint32_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
01720     uint32_t en                           : 1;  /**< Enable. When set, enables the NVMe controller. [EN] is a queue
01721                                                          enable for the SQ's and CPL/CQ's together with corresponding
01722                                                          NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] and NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE]/NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE].
01723                                                          See the NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE] and NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE]
01724                                                          descriptions.
01725                                                          NQM clears [EN] on an FLR to the corresponding function. This
01726                                                          immediately disables the SQ and CPL/CQ transfers for the function.
01727                                                          NQM clears all NQM_VF(0..1027)_CC[EN] on a PF FLR or a PCIe
01728                                                          MAC reset. See NQM_VF(0..1027)_INT[FLR] and NQM_INT[PCIE_MAC_RESET].
01729                                                          See NQM_VF()_INT[FLR,CCW] and corresponding NQM_INTSN_E::NQM_VF()_INT.
01730                                                          OCTEON CPUs can receive an interrupt when [EN] transitions,
01731                                                          perform a controller reset, and eventually clear corresponding
01732                                                          NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY].
01733                                                          NQM clears all NQM_VF(1..1027)_CC[EN] on a VF_ENABLE de-assertion.
01734                                                          VF_ENABLE has no effect on NQM_VF(0)_CC[EN]. See
01735                                                          NQM_INT[PCIE_VF_ENABLE_CLR].
01736                                                          Current NVMe specifications for [EN]:
01737                                                          _ When set, the controller processes commands based
01738                                                           on submission queue tail doorbell writes. When clear, the
01739                                                           controller does not process commands nor post completion queue
01740                                                           entries to Completion Queues. When this field transitions from set to
01741                                                           clear, the controller is reset (referred to as a controller reset). The
01742                                                           reset deletes all I/O submission queues and I/O completion queues,
01743                                                           resets the admin submission queue and completion queue, and brings
01744                                                           the hardware to an idle state. The reset does not affect PCI Express
01745                                                           registers (including MMIO MSI-X registers), nor the admin queue
01746                                                           registers (AQA, ASQ, or ACQ). All other
01747                                                           controller registers and internal controller
01748                                                           state are reset to their default values. The controller ensures
01749                                                           that there is no data loss for commands that have had corresponding
01750                                                           completion queue entries posted to an I/O completion queue prior to
01751                                                           the reset operation.
01752                                                          _ When [EN] is cleared to 0, NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] is cleared to 0 by
01753                                                           the controller once the controller is ready to be re-enabled.
01754                                                           When [EN] is set to 1, the controller sets NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY]
01755                                                           to 1 when it is ready to process commands. CSTS.RDY may be set
01756                                                           to 1 before namespace(s) are ready to be accessed.
01757                                                          _ Setting [EN] from a 0 to a 1 when NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] is a 1,
01758                                                           or clearing [EN] from a '1' to a '0' when NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY]
01759                                                           is a '0,' has undefined results. The Admin Queue registers
01760                                                           (AQA, ASQ, and ACQ) shall only be modified when [EN] is cleared
01761                                                           to 0. */
01762 #else
01763     uint32_t en                           : 1;
01764     uint32_t reserved_1_3                 : 3;
01765     uint32_t css                          : 3;
01766     uint32_t mps                          : 4;
01767     uint32_t ams                          : 3;
01768     uint32_t shn                          : 2;
01769     uint32_t iosqes                       : 4;
01770     uint32_t iocqes                       : 4;
01771     uint32_t reserved_24_31               : 8;
01772 #endif
01773     } s;
01774     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cc_s              cn73xx;
01775 };
01776 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cc cvmx_nqm_vfx_cc_t;
01777 
01778 /**
01779  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cpl#_base_addr_n_sz
01780  *
01781  * NQM_VF(x)_CPL(0..16)_BASE_ADDR_N_SZ are the CPL queue base addresses
01782  * for function x. Includes both admin and IO queues. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE]
01783  * selects the queues and functions that are actually present in the
01784  * hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01785  *
01786  * This CSR should only be written and should only be migrated when this
01787  * CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
01788  * for this CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
01789  */
01790 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cplx_base_addr_n_sz {
01791     uint64_t u64;
01792     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cplx_base_addr_n_sz_s {
01793 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01794     uint64_t reserved_49_63               : 15;
01795     uint64_t qsize                        : 14; /**< This value plus one defines the size of the (octeon) CPL queue queue in entries. The
01796                                                          minimum size of the queue is 2, so 1 should be the minimum programmed value for this
01797                                                          field. */
01798     uint64_t base_addr                    : 35; /**< Base address for the (internal/CNXXXX completion) CPL circular queue
01799                                                          in L2/DRAM memory. The beginning of a CPL queue must be naturally-aligned on
01800                                                          a 128-byte boundary. ([BASE_ADDR] << 7) is the OCTEON L2/DRAM
01801                                                          address of the beginning of the beginning of the CPL queue. */
01802 #else
01803     uint64_t base_addr                    : 35;
01804     uint64_t qsize                        : 14;
01805     uint64_t reserved_49_63               : 15;
01806 #endif
01807     } s;
01808     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cplx_base_addr_n_sz_s cn73xx;
01809 };
01810 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cplx_base_addr_n_sz cvmx_nqm_vfx_cplx_base_addr_n_sz_t;

01816  * Includes both admin and IO queues. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects
01817  * the queues and functions that are actually present in the hardware.

01823  */

01830                                                          To create a new or clear a CPL queue, [HEAD] should be written to zero
01831                                                          prior to initially enabling the CPL/CQ.
01832                                                          For debug and migration. */
01833 #else

01858                                                          are 0 through 32. */
01859 #else

01862 #endif

01868 /**
01869  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cpl#_tdb
01870  *
01871  * NQM_VF(x)_CPL(0..16)_TDB contains the CPL queue tails for function x.
01872  * Includes both admin and IO queues. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the
01873  * queues and functions that are actually present in the hardware.

01886                                                          normal operation.
01887                                                          To create a new or clear a CPL queue, [TAIL] should be written to zero
01888                                                          prior to initially enabling the CPL/CQ. */
01889 #else

01897 
01898 /**
01899  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cq#_base
01900  *
01901  * NQM_VF(x)_CQ(1..16)_BASE are the IO CQ base addresses for function x.
01902  * NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the queues and functions that are actually
01903  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01904  *
01905  * This CSR should only be written and should only be migrated when this
01906  * CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
01907  * for this CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
01908  *
01909  * When configuring a new NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0 (i.e. not physically-contiguous)
01910  * CQ, then software must clear this entire CSR before initially enabling
01911  * the CPL/CQ.
01912  *
01913  * When configuring a new NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=1 (i.e. physically-contiguous) CQ,
01914  * then software must write this CSR to configure [PBA] prior to
01915  * initially enabling the CPL/CQ ([PRIP] and [BV] must be written to
01916  * zero during this write).
01917  */
01918 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_base {
01919     uint64_t u64;
01920     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_base_s {
01921 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01922     uint64_t pba                          : 52; /**< Page base address.  If NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=1 (i.e. physically-contiguous)
01923                                                          then [PBA] is a 64-bit memory page aligned pointer (NQM_VF()_CC[MPS]
01924                                                          selects the page size) to the base of the physically contiguous
01925                                                          queue. Software should derive [PBA] from the PRP entry 1 (PRP1)
01926                                                          field (in CDW6+CDW7) of the create I/O completion queue
01927                                                          command in this case. (If CDW11.PC=0 in the create I/O completion
01928                                                          queue command, but NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=1 due to small
01929                                                          NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[QSIZE], then software must read the first
01930                                                          PRP Entry in the PRP List from host memory, and write it into [PBA].)
01931                                                          If NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0 (i.e. not physically-contiguous)
01932                                                          then [PBA] is managed by hardware during normal
01933                                                          operation. [PBA] can contain a 64-bit memory page aligned
01934                                                          pointer (NQM_VF()_CC[MPS] selects the page size) to the base
01935                                                          of the current page being accessed in this case. */
01936     uint64_t reserved_2_11                : 10;
01937     uint64_t prip                         : 1;  /**< PRP list read in progress. Must always be written to zero by
01938                                                          software.
01939                                                          Managed by hardware during normal operation when
01940                                                          NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0 (i.e. not physically contiguous).
01941                                                          When set, NQM hardware has an outstanding read to the PRP list.
01942                                                          When a PRP list read returns with an error, NQM clears [PRIP,BV]=0,
01943                                                          clears corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE]=0, and sets
01944                                                          NQM_VF()_INT[CQ_FE] for the function.
01945                                                          [PRIP] should be clear more often than not, but if a
01946                                                          function-level reset or VF_ENABLE de-assertion occur during
01947                                                          a PRP list read, NQM hardware may leave [PRIP] continuously set.
01948                                                          The CQ will have been disabled (i.e. corresponding
01949                                                          NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] will have been cleared) by hardware
01950                                                          in this case, and software must clear [PRIP] before re-enabling
01951                                                          the CQ.
01952                                                          [PRIP] reads as zero when NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=1
01953                                                          (i.e. physically contiguous). */
01954     uint64_t bv                           : 1;  /**< When set, [PBA] is valid.
01955                                                          Managed by hardware during normal operation when NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0
01956                                                          (i.e. not physically contiguous). [BV] is often the inverse
01957                                                          of [PRIP] in this case. But [PRIP,BV] may be 0,0 after initialization
01958                                                          before any completions have been sent and after a read error.
01959                                                          When NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=1 (i.e.physically contiguous),
01960                                                          the [BV] read value is the corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE].
01961                                                          [BV] should be written to one by software only on a migration when
01962                                                          NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0 (i.e. not physically contiguous).
01963                                                          [BV] should be written to zero by software in all other circumstances. */
01964 #else
01965     uint64_t bv                           : 1;
01966     uint64_t prip                         : 1;
01967     uint64_t reserved_2_11                : 10;
01968     uint64_t pba                          : 52;
01969 #endif
01970     } s;
01971     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_base_s        cn73xx;
01972 };
01973 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_base cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_base_t;
01974 
01975 /**
01976  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cq#_cc
01977  *
01978  * NQM_VF(x)_CQ(1..16)_CC are the IO CQ config and control CSR's for function x.
01979  * NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the queues and functions that are actually
01980  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
01981  *
01982  * This CSR should only be written and should only be migrated when this
01983  * CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
01984  * for this CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
01985  */
01986 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_cc {
01987     uint64_t u64;
01988     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_cc_s {
01989 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
01990     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
01991     uint64_t qsize                        : 12; /**< Queue size. This value plus one defines the size of the submission
01992                                                          queue in entries. The minimum legal size of 2 entries is [QSIZE]=1.
01993                                                          The maximum legal size of 4096 entries is [QSIZE]=0xFFF.
01994                                                          Software should derive [QSIZE] from the queue size field
01995                                                          (CDW10.QSIZE) of the create I/O Completion Queue command. */
01996     uint64_t reserved_9_15                : 7;
01997     uint64_t iv                           : 5;  /**< Interrupt vector.  Interrupt vector associated with this IO queue.
01998                                                          Valid values are 0..n (a.k.a. NQM_VF_INT_VEC_E::NQM_ADMIN_CQ or
01999                                                          NQM_VF_INT_VEC_E::NVM_CQ(1..n)), where n+1 is the number of
02000                                                          MSI-X vectors present in an NQM function. See the NQM_VF_INT_VEC_E
02001                                                          description.
02002                                                          If [IEN]=0, [IV] should be zeroed.
02003                                                          Software should derive [IV] from the interrupt vector field
02004                                                          and the interrupt enabled field (CDW11.IV and CDW11.IEN) of
02005                                                          the create I/O Completion Queue command. */
02006     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
02007     uint64_t p                            : 1;  /**< Phase tag. Indicates the phase tag that NQM will
02008                                                          write with the next completion.
02009                                                          Software should set [P]=1 prior to first enabling a new
02010                                                          CPL/CQ.
02011                                                          [P] and corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_TAIL[PT] are one and the same.
02012                                                          A write to either [P] or corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_TAIL[PT] updates
02013                                                          both. */
02014     uint64_t ien                          : 1;  /**< Interrupt enable. Interrupts are enabled when asserted.
02015                                                          Software should derive [IV] from the interrupt enabled field
02016                                                          (CDW11.IEN) of the create I/O completion queue command. */
02017     uint64_t pc                           : 1;  /**< Physically contiguous. When set, indicates that the queue is
02018                                                          located in physically contiguous host memory pages. When clear,
02019                                                          indicates that the queue locations are identified by a PRP list.
02020                                                          [PC] must be set for an enabled queue when all queue entries
02021                                                          fit within a single page (NQM_VF()_CC[MPS] selects the page size).
02022                                                          Software should derive [PC] from the physically contiguous field
02023                                                          (CDW11.PC) and queue size field (CDW10.QSIZE) of the create I/O
02024                                                          completion queue command. [PC] should be set when CDW11.PC is set.
02025                                                          [PC] should also be set when CDW11.PC is clear, selecting a
02026                                                          non-contiguous queue, but [QSIZE] is small enough that all
02027                                                          entries fit within a single page. */
02028 #else
02029     uint64_t pc                           : 1;
02030     uint64_t ien                          : 1;
02031     uint64_t p                            : 1;
02032     uint64_t reserved_3_3                 : 1;
02033     uint64_t iv                           : 5;
02034     uint64_t reserved_9_15                : 7;
02035     uint64_t qsize                        : 12;
02036     uint64_t reserved_28_63               : 36;
02037 #endif
02038     } s;
02039     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_cc_s          cn73xx;
02040 };
02041 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_cc cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_cc_t;
02042 
02043 /**
02044  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cq#_ena
02045  *
02046  * NQM_VF(x)_CQ(0..16)_ENA are the completion queue enable CSRs for function x.
02047  * Includes both admin and IO queues. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the queues
02048  * and functions that are actually present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
02049  */
02050 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_ena {
02051     uint64_t u64;
02052     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_ena_s {
02053 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02054     uint64_t reserved_1_63                : 63;
02055     uint64_t enable                       : 1;  /**< Enables completion movement from the OCTEON-internal CPL queue to the
02056                                                          remote host NVMe-standard completion queue.
02057                                                          This CPL/CQ is enabled when all of [ENABLE], corresponding NQM_VF()_CC[EN],
02058                                                          and corresponding NQM_VF()_CSTS[RDY] are set.
02059                                                          The following CSR arrays are related to the host completion queues (CQs):
02060                                                          <pre>
02061                                                           NQM_VF()_CQ()_HDBL
02062                                                           NQM_VF()_CQ()_TAIL
02063                                                           NQM_VF()_CQ()_PRP
02064                                                           NQM_VF()_CQ()_BASE
02065                                                           NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC
02066                                                           NQM_VF()_ACQ
02067                                                           NQM_VF()_AQA[ACQS]
02068                                                           NQM_VF()_ACQ_CC
02069                                                          </pre>
02070                                                          The following CSR arrays are related to the OCTEON-internal CPL queues:
02071                                                          <pre>
02072                                                           NQM_VF()_CPL()_TDB
02073                                                           NQM_VF()_CPL()_BASE_ADDR_N_SZ
02074                                                           NQM_VF()_CPL()_H
02075                                                           NQM_VF()_CPL()_IFC
02076                                                           NQM_VF()_SQ()_CREDIT
02077                                                          </pre>
02078                                                          The following CSR arrays are related to the the MSI-X interrupts that
02079                                                          NQM can create when it moves entries from CPL to CQ:
02080                                                          <pre>
02081                                                           NQM_VF()_VEC()_MSIX_ADDR
02082                                                           NQM_VF()_VEC()_MSIX_CTL
02083                                                           NQM_VF()_MSIX_PBA
02084                                                           NQM_VF()_VEC()_MSIX_CD
02085                                                           NQM_VF()_VEC()_MSIX_INT_ST
02086                                                           NQM_VF()_IC_THR
02087                                                           NQM_VF()_IC_TIME
02088                                                           NQM_VF()_MSIX_CONFIG
02089                                                          </pre>
02090                                                          When the CPL/CQ is enabled, NQM can move available completion queue
02091                                                          entries from the corresponding (OCTEON-internal) CPL queue to the
02092                                                          NVMe-defined admin or IO CQ on the remote host. When the CPL/CQ is
02093                                                          not enabled or there is no available space in the CQ on the remote host,
02094                                                          NQM will not initiate new movements.
02095                                                          When the effective enable for the CPL/CQ transitions 1->0, NQM is
02096                                                          still moving completion queue entries as long as corresponding
02097                                                          NQM_VF()_CPL()_IFC[COUNT]!=0. Once NQM_VF()_CPL()_IFC[COUNT] is
02098                                                          clear after the effective enable transitions 1->0:
02099                                                          *  NQM CPL/CQ hardware has stopped issuing all writes to the
02100                                                             host CQ.
02101                                                          *  After NQM_VF()_CQ()_BASE[PRIP] is also clear, NQM CPL/CQ hardware
02102                                                             also has no outstanding reads, so the CPL/CQ is idle except
02103                                                             possibly for MSI-X interrupts.
02104                                                          *  After the CPL/CQ's are disabled and idle, the MSI-X interrupt
02105                                                             state can be cleared/migrated. Refer to the NQM_VF()_MSIX_PBA
02106                                                             description.
02107                                                          When NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0 (i.e. not physically-contiguous),
02108                                                          NQM hardware clears [ENABLE] when a PRP list entry read
02109                                                          returns an error. This would happen when the remote
02110                                                          host doesn't allow the function to read the entry, for
02111                                                          example. */
02112 #else
02113     uint64_t enable                       : 1;
02114     uint64_t reserved_1_63                : 63;
02115 #endif
02116     } s;
02117     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_ena_s         cn73xx;
02118 };
02119 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_ena cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_ena_t;
02120 
02121 /**
02122  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cq#_hdbl
02123  *
02124  * NQM_VF(x)_CQ(y)_HDBL is the NVMe-standard completion queue y head
02125  * doorbell (CQyHDBL) for function x. Includes both admin and IO queues.
02126  * NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the queues and functions that are actually
02127  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
02128  *
02129  * This CSR should only be migrated when the corresponding
02130  * CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
02131  * for the CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
02132  */
02133 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_hdbl {
02134     uint32_t u32;
02135     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_hdbl_s {
02136 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02137     uint32_t reserved_12_31               : 20;
02138     uint32_t cqh                          : 12; /**< Completion queue head. Indicates the new value of the completion queue
02139                                                          head entry pointer. This value shall overwrite any previous completion
02140                                                          queue head value provided. The difference between the last CQH write
02141                                                          and the current CQH entry pointer write indicates the number of
02142                                                          entries that are now available for re-use by the controller in the
02143                                                          completion queue. */
02144 #else
02145     uint32_t cqh                          : 12;
02146     uint32_t reserved_12_31               : 20;
02147 #endif
02148     } s;
02149     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_hdbl_s        cn73xx;

02153 /**
02154  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_cq#_prp
02155  *
02156  * NQM_VF(x)_CQ(1..16)_PRP are the IO CQ PRP list addresses for function x.
02157  * NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the queues and functions that are actually
02158  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
02159  *
02160  * This CSR should only be written and should only be migrated when this
02161  * CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
02162  * for this CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
02163  *
02164  * When configuring a new NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0 (i.e. not physically-contiguous)
02165  * CQ, software should write this CSR to configure [PRP] prior to
02166  * initially enabling the CPL/CQ.
02167  *
02168  * When configuring a new NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=1 (i.e. physically-contiguous) CQ,
02169  * then software need not write this CSR.
02170  */
02171 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_prp {
02172     uint64_t u64;
02173     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_prp_s {
02174 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02175     uint64_t prp                          : 52; /**< PRP list address.  If NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0 (i.e. not physically-contiguous)
02176                                                          then [PRP] is a 64-bit memory page aligned pointer (NQM_VF()_CC[MPS]
02177                                                          selects the page size) to the base of the (physically contiguous)
02178                                                          PRP list that constitutes the non-physically-contiguous queue.
02179                                                          Software should derive [PRP] from the PRP entry 1 (PRP1)
02180                                                          field (in CDW6+CDW7 of the create I/O completion queue
02181                                                          command) in this case.
02182                                                          If NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=1 (i.e. physically-contiguous,
02183                                                          CDW11.PC=1) then [PRP] is not used by hardware. */
02184     uint64_t reserved_0_11                : 12;
02185 #else
02186     uint64_t reserved_0_11                : 12;
02187     uint64_t prp                          : 52;
02188 #endif
02189     } s;
02190     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_prp_s         cn73xx;
02191 };
02192 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_prp cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_prp_t;

02194 /**

02197  * NQM_VF(x)_CQ(0..16)_TAIL are the CQ tails for function x.
02198  * Includes both admin and IO queues. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the
02199  * queues and functions that are actually present in the hardware. See
02200  * NQM_VF_MODE_E.
02201  *
02202  * This CSR should only be written and should only be migrated when this
02203  * CPL/CQ is idle. The corresponding NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] is an enable
02204  * for this CPL/CQ. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes CPL/CQ idle conditions.
02205  */
02206 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_tail {

02208     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_tail_s {
02209 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02210     uint64_t reserved_13_63               : 51;
02211     uint64_t pt                           : 1;  /**< Phase tag. Indicates the phase tag that NQM will
02212                                                          write with the next completion transferred to the CQ.
02213                                                          Software should set [PT]=1 prior to first enabling a new
02214                                                          CPL/CQ.
02215                                                          [PT] is one and the same as corresponding NQM_VF()_ACQ_CC[P]/
02216                                                          NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[P]. A write to either [PT] or corresponding
02217                                                          NQM_VF()_ACQ_CC[P]/NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[P] updates both. */
02218     uint64_t tail                         : 12; /**< CQ tail entry pointer. Managed by hardware during normal operation.
02219                                                          Indicates the position in the CQ on the remote host that NQM will
02220                                                          write next.
02221                                                          Software should clear [TAIL]=0 prior to first enabling
02222                                                          a new CPL/CQ. */
02223 #else
02224     uint64_t tail                         : 12;
02225     uint64_t pt                           : 1;
02226     uint64_t reserved_13_63               : 51;
02227 #endif
02228     } s;
02229     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_cqx_tail_s        cn73xx;

02253 /**
02254  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_csts
02255  *
02256  * NQM_VF(x)_CSTS is the NVMe-standard controller status (CSTS) CSR for
02257  * function x. NQM_VF_MODE[VF_MODE] selects the functions that are actually
02258  * present in the hardware. See NQM_VF_MODE_E.
02259  */
02260 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_csts {
02261     uint32_t u32;
02262     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_csts_s {
02263 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02264     uint32_t reserved_6_31                : 26;
02265     uint32_t pp                           : 1;  /**< Processing paused: Not supported. (First appeared in NVMe 1.2 specs.)
02266                                                          [PP] indicates whether the controller is processing commands.  If
02267                                                          [PP] is cleared to 0, then the controller is processing commands
02268                                                          normally. If [PP] is set to 1, then the controller has temporarily
02269                                                          stopped processing commands in order to handle an event (e.g.,
02270                                                          firmware activation). This bit is only valid when NQM_VF()_CC[EN]=1. */
02271     uint32_t nssro                        : 1;  /**< NVM subsystem reset is not supported. */
02272     uint32_t shst                         : 2;  /**< Shutdown status. Indicates the status of shutdown processing that is
02273                                                          initiated by the host setting NQM_VF()_CC[SHN].
02274                                                          The shutdown status values are defined as:
02275                                                          0x0 = Normal operation (no shutdown has been requested).
02276                                                          0x1 = Shutdown processing occurring.
02277                                                          0x2 = Shutdown processing complete.
02278                                                          0x3 = Reserved.
02279                                                          To start executing commands on the controller after a shutdown
02280                                                          operation (NQM_VF()_CSTS[SHST] set to 0x2), a controller reset
02281                                                          (NQM_VF()_CC[EN] cleared) is required. If host software submits
02282                                                          commands to the controller without issuing a controller reset,
02283                                                          the behavior is undefined.
02284                                                          This field is read-only from PCIe (SWI). */
02285     uint32_t cfs                          : 1;  /**< Controller fatal status. Set when a fatal controller error occurred
02286                                                          that could not be communicated in the appropriate completion queue.
02287                                                          Cleared when a fatal controller error has not occurred. The reset
02288                                                          value of this field is 1 when a fatal controller error is detected
02289                                                          during controller initialization.
02290                                                          This field is read-only from PCIe (SWI). */
02291     uint32_t rdy                          : 1;  /**< Ready. When set, the NVMe controller is ready to process commands
02292                                                          after the corresponding NQM_VF()_CC[EN] is set. [RDY] is a queue
02293                                                          enable for the SQ's and CPL/CQ's together with corresponding
02294                                                          NQM_VF()_CC[EN] and NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE]/NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE].
02295                                                          See the NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE] and NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE]
02296                                                          descriptions.
02297                                                          [RDY] is RO from PCIe, but internally writable.
02298                                                          Current NVMe specifications for [RDY]:
02299                                                          _ [RDY] is set to 1 when the controller is ready to accept Submission
02300                                                           Queue Tail doorbell writes after NQM_VF()_CC[EN] is set to 1. [RDY]
02301                                                           shall be cleared to 0 when NQM_VF()_CC[EN] is cleared to 0. Commands
02302                                                           shall not be submitted to the controller until [RDY] is set
02303                                                           to 1 after NQM_VF()_CC[EN] is set to 1. Failure to follow this
02304                                                           requirement produces undefined results. Host software shall wait
02305                                                           a minimum of NQM_VF()_CAP[TO] seconds for this field to be set
02306                                                           to 1 after setting NQM_VF()_CC[EN] to 1 from a previous value of 0. */
02307 #else
02308     uint32_t rdy                          : 1;
02309     uint32_t cfs                          : 1;
02310     uint32_t shst                         : 2;
02311     uint32_t nssro                        : 1;
02312     uint32_t pp                           : 1;
02313     uint32_t reserved_6_31                : 26;
02314 #endif
02315     } s;
02316     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_csts_s            cn73xx;
02317 };
02318 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_csts cvmx_nqm_vfx_csts_t;

02332                                                          completion queue entries to aggregate per interrupt vector before
02333                                                          signaling an interrupt to the host. This is a 0's based value.
02334                                                          [CTIME] should be derived from the Aggregation Threshold (CDW11.THR)

02348 /**
02349  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_ic_time
02350  *
02351  * This register controls the interrupt coalescing time.
02352  *
02353  */
02354 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_ic_time {
02355     uint64_t u64;
02356     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_ic_time_s {
02357 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02358     uint64_t reserved_8_63                : 56;
02359     uint64_t ctime                        : 8;  /**< Coalescing time.  Specifies the maximum time in 100 microsecond
02360                                                          increments that a controller may delay an interrupt due to interrupt
02361                                                          coalescing.  A value of 0x0 corresponds to no delay (i.e., disabling
02362                                                          this capability). The controller applies this time across all

02365                                                          in a interrupt coalescing (feature identifier 0x08) set features

02375 
02376 /**
02377  * cvmx_nqm_vf#_int
02378  *
02379  * This register provides status and clears per-VF interrupts sources.  If a bit
02380  * in this register ANDed with NQM_VF()_INT_ENA_W1C is true then
02381  * NQM_INTSN_E::NQM_VF()_INT is thrown.
02382  */
02383 union cvmx_nqm_vfx_int {
02384     uint64_t u64;
02385     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_int_s {
02386 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
02387     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
02388     uint64_t sli_err                      : 1;  /**< A DPI DMA or CPU read to the NQM (i.e. PEM0 PF2) function returned with
02389                                                          an error. This could be because of a bad pointer, FLR, or other reasons
02390                                                          related to the function. An FLR when there are inflight reads to the remote host
02391                                                          function can cause [SLI_ERR] to assert when the reads would normally
02392                                                          complete successfully. During an FLR, it is possible for [SLI_ERR] to
02393                                                          continually be set while DPI drains DMA instructions reading the
02394                                                          function that were queued before the FLR.
02395                                                          In the DPI DMA case where the instruction that caused [SLI_ERR] to
02396                                                          be set generates a completion status, DPI_CS_E::ERRRSP is the completion
02397                                                          status for the DPI DMA instruction.
02398                                                          When an FLR was not the [SLI_ERR] assertion cause, [SLI_ERR] assertion
02399                                                          should typically coincide with one or more completions with a data transfer
02400                                                          error (value 4) status code. When an FLR was the cause, NQM hardware
02401                                                          will have recently sent [FLR]. */
02402     uint64_t sq_fe                        : 1;  /**< Submission queue fatal error. NQM asserts [SQ_FE] when a PRP list entry
02403                                                          read from a SQ in the function completes with an error status.
02404                                                          This could be because of a bad PRP list pointer, FLR, or other reasons
02405                                                          related to the function. An FLR can cause [SQ_FE] to assert for a
02406                                                          normally-operating SQ that is not idle when the FLR is initiated.
02407                                                          The SQ(s) causing [SQ_FE] to assert must have NQM_VF()_SQ()_CC[PC]=0,
02408                                                          and NQM clears their NQM_VF()_SQ()_BASE[PRIP,BV]=0,0, and
02409                                                          NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE]=0 when the error occurs.
02410                                                          When an FLR was not the [SQ_FE] assertion cause, [SQ_FE] assertion
02411                                                          should result in a controller fatal error reported back to the host
02412                                                          via NQM_VF()_CSTS[CFS]. When an FLR was the cause, NQM will have
02413                                                          set [FLR]. */
02414     uint64_t cq_fe                        : 1;  /**< Completion queue fatal error. NQM asserts [CQ_FE] when a PRP list entry
02415                                                          read from a CQ in the function completes with an error status.
02416                                                          This could be because of a bad PRP list pointer, FLR, or other reasons
02417                                                          related to the function. An FLR can cause [CQ_FE] to assert for a
02418                                                          normally-operating CQ that is not idle when the FLR is initiated.
02419                                                          The CQ(s) causing [CQ_FE] to assert must have NQM_VF()_CQ()_CC[PC]=0,
02420                                                          and NQM clears their NQM_VF()_CQ()_BASE[PRIP,BV]=0,0, and
02421                                                          NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE]=0 when the error occurs.
02422                                                          When an FLR was not the [CQ_FE] assertion cause, [CQ_FE] assertion
02423                                                          should result in a controller fatal error reported back to the host
02424                                                          via NQM_VF()_CSTS[CFS]. When an FLR was the cause, NQM will have
02425                                                          set [FLR]. */
02426     uint64_t asq_cfg                      : 1;  /**< Administration submission queue configuration. Asserted when the host
02427                                                          changes the configuration of the admin SQ while it is enabled.
02428                                                          NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes admin SQ enable conditions.
02429                                                          This error should typically result in a controller fatal error
02430                                                          reported back to the host via NQM_VF()_CSTS[CFS]. */
02431     uint64_t acq_cfg                      : 1;  /**< Administration completion queue configuration. Asserted when the host
02432                                                          changes the configuration of the admin CQ while it is enabled.
02433                                                          NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes admin CPL/CQ enable conditions.
02434                                                          This error should typically result in a controller fatal error
02435                                                          reported back to the host via NQM_VF()_CSTS[CFS]. */
02436     uint64_t cq_db_val                    : 1;  /**< Completion queue doorbell value: Asserted when host software writes a
02437                                                          doorbell value via PCIe that exceeds the size of the CQ, or is the
02438                                                          same as the previous written value or attempts to remove from an
02439                                                          empty CQ (underflow) while enabled. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE]
02440                                                          describes CPL/CQ enable conditions.
02441                                                          This error should typically result in software posting an invalid
02442                                                          doorbell write value (value 1) error status asynchronous event to the
02443                                                          host. */
02444     uint64_t cq_db                        : 1;  /**< Completion queue doorbell. Asserted when host software writes the
02445                                                          doorbell of a CQ that is disabled. NQM_VF()_CQ()_ENA[ENABLE]
02446                                                          describes CPL/CQ enable conditions.
02447                                                          This error should typically result in software posting an invalid
02448                                                          doorbell register (value 0) error status asynchronous event to the host. */
02449     uint64_t sq_db_val                    : 1;  /**< Submission queue doorbell value: Asserted when host software writes a
02450                                                          doorbell value via PCIe that exceeds the size of the SQ, or is the
02451                                                          same as the previous written value or attempts to add to a full SQ
02452                                                          (overflow) while enabled. NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes
02453                                                          SQ enable conditions.
02454                                                          This error should typically result in software posting an invalid
02455                                                          doorbell write value (value 1) error status asynchronous event to the
02456                                                          host. */
02457     uint64_t sq_db                        : 1;  /**< Submission queue doorbell. Asserted when host software writes the
02458                                                          doorbell of a SQ that is disabled. NQM_VF()_SQ()_ENA[ENABLE] describes
02459                                                          SQ enable conditions.
02460                                                          This error should typically result in software posting an invalid
02461                                                          doorbell register (value 0) error status asynchronous event to the host. */
02462     uint64_t flr                          : 1;  /**< Function-level reset interrupt.  This bit is asserted when a PCIe
02463                                                          function-level reset to the function has been initiated. */
02464     uint64_t ccw                          : 1;  /**< Controller configuration write interrupt.  This bit is asserted anytime
02465                                                          the NQM_VF()_CC register is written via PCIe.  This can be used to
02466                                                          notify OCTEON software that the shutdown notification (SHN) and/or
02467                                                          the enable (EN) fields have changed. */
02468 #else
02469     uint64_t ccw                          : 1;
02470     uint64_t flr                          : 1;
02471     uint64_t sq_db                        : 1;
02472     uint64_t sq_db_val                    : 1;
02473     uint64_t cq_db                        : 1;
02474     uint64_t cq_db_val                    : 1;
02475     uint64_t acq_cfg                      : 1;
02476     uint64_t asq_cfg                      : 1;
02477     uint64_t cq_fe                        : 1;
02478     uint64_t sq_fe                        : 1;
02479     uint64_t sli_err                      : 1;
02480     uint64_t reserved_11_63               : 53;
02481 #endif
02482     } s;
02483     struct cvmx_nqm_vfx_int_s             cn73xx;
02484 };
02485 typedef union cvmx_nqm_vfx_int cvmx_nqm_vfx_int_t;
